entry.title: [sync] Hide UI to enter passphrase if sync setup in progress
entry.content:
For custom passphrase users that go through the advanced sync setup

flow, asking them for the passphrase before they click on "Confirm" is

not really needed, just like the UI (at least currently) doesn't ask for

the passphrase if the user is signed in without sync.



With this patch, the UI to enter the passphrase is no longer displayed,

until the user clicks "Confirm".



Hiding this UI also means there is no need to consider what the behavior

should be if the user clicks "Cancel" after having entered the

passphrase, as it isn't obvious if the user would expect to clear

remember the passphrase or not.



Technically, this also removes a problematic codepath, namely one that

invokes SyncService::StopAndClear(). This API is error-prone and should

ideally be removed altogether.



Bug: 1259054

Change-Id: I296bfc4da8ef65fa26124ca7ce19299e5ded6bfc

entry.title: [InsertableStreams] Drop frames received on the wrong task runner
entry.content:
It can happen during transfer that a frame is posted from the

background media thread to the task runner of the old execution

context, which can lead to races and UAF.



This CL makes underlying sources drop frames received on the

wrong task runner to avoid the problem.

properly removed from the PromiseAppRegistryCache. This ensures that the

Launcher/ Shelf can still access the icons until the very end of the

promise app's lifetime.

entry.title: [Per-App Language] Modify AppLocale saving condition on package refresh
entry.content:
As discussed here:

http://go/arcfw:arc-per-app-language#bookmark=id.z5o8bjbsyz6o, there's a

possibility of settings mismatch between ChromeOS and ARC. As we

consider ChromeOS to be source of truth, we should ignore ARC-boot

package sync for appLocale if there's a mismatch, and sends back the

correct locale to ensure both are re-synced.



ARC mojom change is added here: ag/25446342



--gtest_filter=*ArcAppModelBuilderTest*



Bug: b:261200827

entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/4644891 introduced service worker's

kServiceWorkerScopeCacheLimit feature. We are not checking the feature's

status, and only use the kServiceWorkerScopeCacheLimitSize

parameter. So enabling kServiceWorkerScopeCacheLimit does not

matter. This CL enables kServiceWorkerScopeCacheLimit to clarify that

this is taking effect.

entry.title: Revert "Dispatch close event when MessagePort is disentangled"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6a74d3d8049e1744b862757a73f90f3d7a5e08b0.



Reason for revert:

The tests newly added by the original CL are failing on

chrome_wpt_tests on the Linux Tests bot:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests/138259/overview



Original change's description:

> Dispatch close event when MessagePort is disentangled

>

> We want to dispatch a close event when an entangled MessagePort is disconnected.

> Given a pair of entangled ports, port1 and port2, if port2 is closed at any point,

> a port1’s error handler is run.

> So we can change an error handler to dispatch a close event.

>

> The tests of close event are as follows:

> 1) port was explicitly closed.

> 2) owning document was destroyed.

> 3) owning document crashed.

> 4) port was garbage collected.

>

> Design Doc:https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lXZU2Pk2ycitqj8aL9kxT2aauwXqpA0vJDUalkXA29Y

> Explainer:https://github.com/fergald/explainer-messageport-close

> HTML spec PR:https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9933

>

entry.title: Revert "Initialize feature and field trial state in app shims."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 05dc0d76b85428669a02367bb967477e7e0b0411.



Reason for revert:

Speculative revert for failures on Mac ASan 64 Tests.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac%20ASan%2064%20Tests%20(1)/87373/overview



Original change's description:

> Initialize feature and field trial state in app shims.

>

> App shim execution roughly follows three phases:

> 1) Early startup, which finds the correct chrome framework to dlopen.

> 2) Bootstrap, where the shim either finds a running chrome instance

> to connect to, or launches a new chrome instance.

> 3) Running, after communication has been established with chrome.

>

> There is no need for base::Feature support in 1), as the code there

> should be as minimal as possible, and depend on as little chrome code

> as possible.

>

> In 3) we want to make sure that feature state exactly matches that of

> the chrome version we're connected to. To accomplish this, in the first

> mojo message reply from chrome to the app shim we pass along the feature

> and field trial state for the app shim to use, and initialize

> FieldTrialList and FeatureList with that.

>

> In 2) we can't guarantee that the feature state exactly matches that of

> the chrome version we will be connecting to. As such we don't want to

> allow unfettered base::Feature usage here, but some usage (for example

> in mojo code, but also soon in some other places) is/will be

> unavoidable. Since in this case code has to be able to deal with the

> feature state not matching chrome, explicit opt-in is required.

>

> To initialize feature state in 2) we do two different things:

> - For app shims launched by chrome, we pass feature and field trial

> state on the command line.

> - For app shims launched directly by the OS or user, chrome writes

> the feature/field trial state the last time it ran to a file in

> user data dir. This file is then read by the app shim to initialize

> its state. Additionally we also apply explicit enabled/disabled

> features passed on the command line, and forward these to chrome if

> the app shim ends up launching chrome.

>

> Bug: 1378728

> Change-Id: I1db33ffe7cd350eabe5819532eb267a0ebfcc449

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4860440

> Reviewed-by: Mark Mentovai

> Commit-Queue: Marijn Kruisselbrink

> Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

entry.title: Add exception for Korean IME to modifier remapping
entry.content:
Right alt in the Korean IME acts as an IME switcher. Previously, it was

activated on Key Up, but was recently UX decision to change it to

activate on KeyDown which keyboard shortcuts and the IME switch

happening at the same time.



A patch was made to modify the xkb for the Korean IME

(crrev.com/c/5036064) to utilize a DomKey of HANGUL_MODE instead of ALT

for the right alt key.



This patch makes modifier remapping skip over remapping the right alt

key if the DomKey is HANGUL_MODE.



Bug: b/311333438, b/298907146

Change-Id: I3390cea56f4de756b6a50ed05145b1ade1582954

entry.title: Dispatch close event when MessagePort is disentangled
entry.content:
We want to dispatch a close event when an entangled MessagePort is disconnected.

Given a pair of entangled ports, port1 and port2, if port2 is closed at any point,

a port1’s error handler is run.

So we can change an error handler to dispatch a close event.



The tests of close event are as follows:

1) port was explicitly closed.

2) owning document was destroyed.

3) owning document crashed.

4) port was garbage collected.



Design Doc:https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lXZU2Pk2ycitqj8aL9kxT2aauwXqpA0vJDUalkXA29Y

Explainer:https://github.com/fergald/explainer-messageport-close

HTML spec PR:https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9933



Bug: 1495616

Change-Id: I99f9f5a0d7cc63f0916da316ec666ba793215019

entry.title: Revert "Remove `will_cause_resize` from WebContents::ExitFullscreen()"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1abc874e14b8148de9451e7983ed05eedfa7a810.



Reason for revert: Causing resize janks crbug.com/1506034



Original change's description:

> Remove `will_cause_resize` from WebContents::ExitFullscreen()

>

> This CL fixes a regression on Mac that if a web page enters the tab

> fullscreen mode and then exits fullscreen by system controls (keyboard

> shortcuts or window control buttons), the page becomes

> fullscreen-in-tab. This issue was caused by the browser not sending

> a resize message to the renderer after browser has exited fullscreen.

> Specifically, the resize message isn't sent because the browser

> is told that there will by another resize event and skips this message

> when `will_cause_resize` is True.

>

> This issue can be solved by removing the `will_cause_resize` parameter

> from WebContents::ExitFullscreen() so that a resize message is sent

> every time this function is called to exit fullscreen.

>

> The `will_cause_resize` flag was initially added to restore the

> scroll position when toggling fullscreen mode crrev.com/1488653002

> However, the scroll restoration was later removed because of its

> complexity by crrev.com/c/1195714 and this flag wasn't cleaned up

> at that time.

>

> There are several places where a True value is passed to

> `will_cause_resize` i.e. exit fullscreen when showing a printer pop

> up dialog. These use cases shouldn't be affected by having another

> page resize.

entry.title: Add a signal from blink to autofill for hidden elements using styling
entry.content:
Autofill currently doesn't get notified when an form or form

control element becomes hidden in the DOM. Autofill can use this to

improve form submission detection and possibly keep their forms up to

date via form extraction.



This CL adds logic so that when an element's style changes and its

focusability changes to unfocusable, we notify the AutofillAgent.

entry.title: Use menuItemCount for setting order while adding menuItems
entry.content:
orderInCategory attribute of menuItem can be same for menu items

in various menu groups and thus can have conflicts while adding

in menu. Due to above reason, menuItem order is not as intended.



Use menuItemCount as offset while adding menuItem in menu.

This approach ensures that both group order and order within

the group is considered while ordering. It also ensures global

contiguity among menuItem while ordering.





Bug: 1499151

entry.title: documentScan: Add ash crosapi layer to retrieve scan data
entry.content:
StartPreparedScan will start a scan using a scanner handle that was

returned from a call to OpenScanner and, if successful, return a job

handle. That job handle is then used in ReadScanData to retrieve the

next chunk of scan data that is available.



Both of these simply forward requests to lorgnette and send responses

back. The bulk of this change is converting between protobuf and mojom.

entry.title: Clear the redundant apps saved in AppStorage.
entry.content:
When the user removes apps from other devices, the apps on local device

are synced. The apps could disappear from the publisher init app list

during the system startup phase. However, the apps could still be saved

in the AppStorage file.



This CL adds the OnAppsInitialized AppRegistryCache::Observer interface

for AppStorage. And compare `delta` published from the publisher during

the init phase when should_notify_initialized=true. If the saved apps

are not in the init app list, uninstall apps to remove it from the

AppStorage file.



Remove the redundant apps:: namespace in the app_storage files.



BUG=1385932, b:312590684



Change-Id: I66352f28124a255534bd8d36650dcd06e575881d

entry.title: Fix UnifiedBrightnessSliderController to handle move-only PressedCallbacks.
entry.content:
`CreateView()` was passing the callback by copy, but it can simply

consume with `std::move()` instead, since `CreateView()` can only be

called once. This also fixes a dangling pointer field: the dangling

pointer was only ever used to enforce that `CreateView()` is only called

once. The same can be done by simply tracking a bool.

entry.title: Do not recreate the border if there already exists
entry.content:
To improve the performance of rounded windows, this CL prevents

`SetButtonSize` from recreating the empty border for padding.

Because `SetButtonSize` is called on every layout event,

always-recreating-border causes a significant performance issue on

low-end CrOS devices.

entry.title: [codeql] Create a script to automatically index CodeQL databases.
entry.content:
CodeQL is a semantic code analysis engine that can index e.g. Chromium,

making it possible to query the codebase via its query language. Among

other things, the query language allows for taint tracking and data

flow analysis, which are useful for finding & fixing potential

security vulnerabilities.



There's been scripts for building CodeQL databases before, but none

that "live" in Chrome.



By default the script indexes all of Chromium, but if passed a gn

target, it can compile a database with just the transitive

dependencies for that target, to make building the database and

subsequently querying it faster.



Subsequent work will call this script from a recipe so it can be

automated by a LUCI job.



Bug: 1506812

Change-Id: I8e0b92ee0ec94863a94a21601b5b5764c16fa88a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4895844

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Bruce Dawson

Commit-Queue: Julia Hansbrough

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1231685}

entry.content:

fine since it has the only reference to the service controller. If other

down the service after collecting metrics.

entry.title: Remove base::Passed usage from MockJobTask.
entry.content:
MockJobTask supports construction from a OnceCallback or a

RepeatingCallback. Internally, it stored a RepeatingCallback, and uses

base::Passed() to adapt a OnceCallback into a RepeatingCallback.

However:



- base::Passed() is a pre-C++11-ism that has been replaced by

std::move() for many years now.

- Using base::Passed() to use a move-only type with a RepeatingCallback

can have unintuitive effects if the callback is run more than

once—subsequent invocations of the callback after the first will

receive a moved-from value.



For these reasons, base::Passed() is being removed from the codebase.

MockJobTask now stores a variant of OnceCallback+RepeatingCallback, but

all other behaviour remains the same as before. Attempting to run the

OnceCallback variant more than once will simply fail (as it would have

before).



Bug: 1326449

Change-Id: I5c0ccd30b67cf88e340a8c99fe832b72043b3983

entry.title: Stop playback after translating/reverting translation
entry.content:
When page is translated, or translation is reverted, we should stop the playback.

Additionally, when checking if highlighting is supported, we're checking if a page is translated and blocking it if so (there's a bug where UI is not properly disabled, I'll look into that next).

Caveat, if someone tries translating to and from the same language eg. English to English, we will show page as translated and disable highlighting, but that's WAI according to translate algorithms.

entry.title: Reland "[autopip] Add debugging for flaky test."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 74bf0aba91b57264a053401c4a1e5655b2e9490c



The flakiness was caused by the test's MediaSessionObserver finding

out about playback state changes before the tab helper sometimes,

because ordering and timing are not guaranteed. As a result, the

test would proceed when it thought playback had reached the right

state, but the tab helper would behave as if it hadn't.



The test now flushes the observers after getting into the right

state, so that everybody agrees. It also adds an explicit check

for "started playing" beyond looking for audio focus, so that

it knows when to flush the observers in that case too.



Original change's description:

> [autopip] Add debugging for flaky test.

>

> Bug: 1505509

> Change-Id: Iea066c9a33bd24e1dc808c55ffd856af47228e04

entry.title: [Apk Web Apps] Remove prefs correctly when TWA install source is removed
entry.content:
Web Apps can be installed by multiple sources. If an APK web app package

is removed, the app will only be uninstalled if no other install sources

remain.



ApkWebAppService was not correctly handling the case where the app

remains after the APK package was removed. As a result, the system would

continue to treat the app as an APK web app incorrectly.



To fix this, we just need to clear out the associated prefs as soon as

the app has its Web App Store install source is removed.

entry.title: WebNN: Define Where in mojo and implement it in DirectML backend
entry.content:
According to the WebNN spec[1], Where operator selects the values from

the input or the other tensor depending on the corresponding Boolean

values of the condition tensor.



This CL defines Where operator in mojo and implement it in DirectML

backend, some unittests are also added.



This CL also fixes some naming nits:

`input` -> `true_value` and `other` -> `false_value`.



[1] https://pr-preview.s3.amazonaws.com/webmachinelearning/webnn/pull/478.html#api-mlgraphbuilder-where

entry.title: [linux/wayland] Fix wrong size extension menu
entry.content:
The wayland window always returns 0,0 as position because in Wayland we

don't know the position of the window in the screen.



As a result `anchor_rect` and `screen_rect` in

BubbleDialogDelegate::GetMaxAvailableScreenSpaceToPlaceBubble would not

be accurate in regular Wayland compositors, i.e. the position of

`anchor_rect` ends up being ~= the position of the anchor view in the

window instead of position in the screen as is the case with X11, while

`screen_rect` ends up being the rect for whichever display is found

nearest to that potentially erroneous `anchor_rect` value.



In multi-display setups this is exaggerated in certain cases as reported

with some specific relative positioning of displays where the nearest

display returned is wrong and/or `screen_rect` does not contain

`anchor_rect`, causing the available space calculation to be negative

and forced to be zero. This makes the extension popup use the `kMinSize`

value of 25 which is why we see the narrow width.



So remove the usage of

BubbleDialogDelegate::GetMaxAvailableScreenSpaceToPlaceBubble and just

using the default `kMaxSize` (800x600) in those platforms which would

fix the max value mistakenly being set to 25 when the function returns 0

and for the most part behave similar to non-reproducible cases where the

function doesn't return a zero value, because in most other cases it

just happens to return a size equal to or bigger than the default which

then gets clamped to the default dimensions anyway.



Fixed: 1282790

Change-Id: I588069042cd8321d7100fc174440bc2dce3b7d6c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5069774

Reviewed-by: Elly FJ

Commit-Queue: Orko Garai

Reviewed-by: Max Ihlenfeldt

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1231642}

entry.title: [remoting] Set the GNOME text-scaling-factor to match the requested DPI.
entry.content:
GNOME has 2 dconf/GSettings keys which control the size of rendered

text:

* scaling-factor (default is 0.0)

* text-scaling-factor (default is 1.0)

(both are in /org/gnome/desktop/interface/)



The first controls the overall GNOME scaling. If this is 0, GNOME will

automatically choose a scaling based on the resolution and physical

dimensions of the display. GNOME currently only supports integer

scaling for X11.



The second controls the size of text-rendering and is applied on top

of the current GNOME scaling factor. For example, if the current GNOME

scaling is 2x, and text-scaling-factor is 2.0, any text would be

rendered 4x larger than if both scalings were 1.



This CL causes the host to change the text-scaling-factor in response

to a ClientResolution request, which includes the client's DPI. The

new value is calculated (using GNOME's current scaling factor) to

produce the required text-rendering for the client's DPI.



Bug: b:268730721

Change-Id: Ie6c20699a01b651e1808f8fb488892796d0935de

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4974867

Reviewed-by: Jamie Walch

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1231630}

entry.title: desk_profiles: Make app_type optional in saved desk JSON
entry.content:
This change makes it so that the `app_type` field in saved desks is

optional. This field normally holds values like "BROWSER" or "ARC". The

field is not strictly needed in order to later launch a saved desk.



The reason for the change is that in order to retrieve the app type for

a given app ID, the AppregistryCache is queried. This cache isn't always

ready for when we need it.



BUG=b:308823694

entry.title: [X11] Add Geometry Cache
entry.content:
This is necessary since ui::X11Window needs to keep track of the window

geometry relative to the root window. On every configure event (which

occurs when a window is moved or resized), a synchronous

TranslateCoordinates call is made to convert the event geometry from

the parent window's coordinates to the root window's coordinates.

This is potentially expensive for an interactive operation like

moving or resizing windows, so this CL adds a GeometryCache to avoid

this. The TranslateCoordinates call will be removed in a followup.



R=sky



Bug: 739898

Change-Id: If1851ca9b0769bc7ef5c44be5ccaa2aeb522222d
